Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, not recommended for small children.”
Reviews.Author: AnnaJenkins
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated within easy walking distance of the train station so transfers to and from the airport were easy and cheap (€4 each way per person by coach). We had explicitly ordered a cot via the booking website and I had followed this up with an email and had confirmation that one would be in the room. When we arrived there wasn't one available for the first night and so our 22 month son had to sleep in our bed. There wasn't a high chair available for breakfast so he had to sit on a pile of towels! There wasn't a cocktail bar as described on the website and the breakfast was not the best quality (no bread one day, plastic cheese, tinned fruit etc.) There is a stop for an open top bus tour right outside the front door which was very handy. You can walk to all of the major sites (obviously being a city they are not all round the corner!). There are plenty of good restaurants nearby. We had a fabulous holiday, but just wanted to warn other parents of the lack of toddler facilities in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever. They stole us.”
Reviews.Author: tatianahma
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dirty, doesnt have hot water, it says they have parking, but they dont have. Service is awful. We paid for a luxury room, they gave us a standart one, but didnt give our money back. We have a video that the manager promise to give the refound, and another video in the check out when another employer says that they'll keep our money. Never go there!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mherring59
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely with a great receptionist who is very helpful in finding restaurants, attractions, and taxis. The room we had was a family room, very spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was also excellent and alot of variety. The location was a bit out of the way for the metro, but if you don't mind walking its fine. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Historic and grand but in need of a make over”
Reviews.Author: rockstar53
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Antico Palazzo Rospigliosi on a ten day business trip. There is no doubt that this is a hotel that is in many ways a stunning representation of history. The 500 year old Chapel in the hotel is stunningly beautiful and the large common lounge area is classic and elegant. Whilst my room was small, it was cosy, and was certainly enough for a weary traveller and the bed was comfortable. A big sash style window could be opened for fresh air and this was a real plus. The courtyard below my window was charming. However, with history comes age and this was evident in some of the 'cover up' refurbishment done in the rooms. The ceilings in my room had signs of mould and the bath needed replacing as did the clean but aged basin. I did not use the air conditioning because I felt the mould was probably through the filters there as well. Like many European hotels, there was no iron in the room and I had to share the iron and ironing board with the whole hotel. The staff had no idea where the iron was once it was borrowed. Whilst the staff were friendly enough, they were quite reserved and when I got caught in the tiny lift for over half an hour with 5 other people they refused to open up another entry with a stairwell for us to use because they said it was a security risk. To be fair, this was probably true, but this meant that the tiny lifts were overcrowded constantly and I lived in fear of another 'trapped' episode throughout my stay. The hotel is oddly converted into a maze of floors that did not seem to follow logic and one never quite knew where some of the rooms were - numbers that should have followed a logical sequence did not and I ended up completely lost looking for colleagues a number of times. Breakfast was reasonably good but the dinner we had provided for our group was poor to say the least. Staff were not always warm or welcoming in the breakfast room or dining room either. One plus is the position which is without a doubt fantastic and within walking distance of everything I needed. Would I stay there again? Possibly but would like to see some serious renovation work done in places.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: JanB000
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean room with qute large bathroom. Located close to Termini annot far fraom Colosseum, Breakfast included, but was not as good as one could exprxt.

Reviews.Title: “don't know what people are complaining about....”
Reviews.Author: LotteBrad
Reviews.Content: I have to write this review as we have just returned from a weekend at the Antico Palazzo Rospigliosi and wanted to share our experiences. We found the location fantastic, VERY quick walk from Termini, and an easy walk to many of the sights. The open top bus tours stop outside the hotel and there are many good restaurants nearby.The hotel was very clean, the staff very friendly, the room & bathroom big very comfortable, and breakfast excellent. Now it may be that we have been in Italy too long (been living in Napoli for 2 years) and have got used to all things Italian, but personally speaking we thought this to be an excellent choice for central Rome, and also very good value for money. Don't be put off by previous people, for us, it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location and great price”
Reviews.Author: troy k
Reviews.Content: I used trip advisor for all my hotel research before booking a two week trip to Italy in Sept/2011 and now having stayed at most of the hotels I have to say I'm boggled by the reviews and rankings. I didn't actually review this hotel, or book it - I booked Hotel Saturnia instead, which overall is ranked a lot higher that Antico Palazzo Rospigliosi. However, after arriving at Hotel Saturnia it was so incredibly bad that we decided to give up the 388 Euros we prepaid and find something else (it was our honeymoon and my wife literally sat down on the bed and cried at Saturnia, and her last visit to Italy she stayed in hostels - what does that say!). About two blocks away we found Antico Palazzo Rospigliosi. We asked if they had a room available and they said yes, we asked if it had air conditioning - yes, toilet - yes, windows - yes, so already it was better than Saturnia. We asked if we could see it - yes. We were blown away! Now, I've stayed in much more upscale hotels around the world, but I've also stayed in far worse - but what surprised me was that this was basically the same price per night as Saturnia but it was 10 times better. Our room was one of the larger rooms we stayed in during our trip (stayed in 5 hotels, not including Saturnia), it was clean and given we overlooked the square with a busy road it was very quiet. Breakfast was decent, eggs (never had a problem getting any as one reviewer wrote, but I did find that sometime the warmer flame would be out so they wouldn't be that warm), cheese, meats, pastries, etc. The best part was that you could ask them to make you a latte or cappuccino. The clerks were very friendly and gave us great restaurant recommendations and directions (they did give us wrong information about their laundry service being open on Sunday, but it worked out even better for us as they ended up sending us to a place that did our laundry for a fraction of the price). I only can complain about one thing - we wanted fresh towels so we through them on the floor in the bathroom expecting they'd give us clean ones but they picked them up and put them back on the towel racks! If it weren't for that, and if the breakfast had been a little better I would have given it 5 stars. One note about the air conditioning and the lights, something I hadn't seen before but did see again in Venice and that is you have to have your room key card (although I was told by a friend later you can stick anything in that fits) in a slot to keep the lights and air conditioning on - and the air conditioning is set at 25C, which is a little warm but reasonable I think. Also, they have free parking (but limited spaces) around the corner. They will tell you that there is no security and to be honest I was a little worried. But we parked a BMW there for 3 nights over a weekend and had no problems. If anyone has stayed in this hotel and found a better hotel in ancient Rome in the same price range I'd love to hear from you.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: gameshow
Reviews.Content: If there is one thing about this sight. it is that there are so many different reviews. I am glad that I didn't read them before I stayed here because I would have been very wary of this place. I can only tell you my feelings and as the title says they were mixed. To begin with, I was with a tour so I didn't pick this hotel. We all arrived in the morning and none of the rooms were ready. I had guessed that since it was morning and we all were arriving around 8AM that they would not be ready. OK, but the lobby (waiting room) was tiny and with the whole group along with all our luggage, well, that leaves very little room. Once we were settled (sometime in the afternoon) my room was on the first floor accessed by a very tiny elevator, then I could appreciate the hotel better. The room was small but adequate and the bath was decent except the shower was so small I could barely turn around and I am not a large person. Our room was overlooking an alley so there was really no noise from the main street which was only a few feet away. The hotel itself was charming and I was told was over 500 years old and belonged at one time to a Cardinal. It had a beautiful church in it and being this was a Catholic tour we had Mass every morning. Breakfast was disappointing as every morning when I arrived, there were no more eggs. I shouldn't have to be the first one there to be served. By the time more eggs were served it was time for the tour to leave. As I've stated, I liked many things about this hotel especially the location, but there were other issues which made for a stay which could have been superior, but left me wanting more. The hotel I stayed at in Florence was far better.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service + Super dirty facilities”
Reviews.Author: MAKHK
Reviews.Content: I would like to raise up a very serious complaint in this hotel. We arrive on day early in Rome on 30Jul, we request a triple room 1 day earlier. Manger said it is full house of triple room, then we said no problem for the double room, But the manager only said "not possible" . You have to reserve 1double room + 1 single room. We explain to him my son only 15 years old. We would like to stay together. Finally, there is a lady in the reservation desk help us to reserve their "sister hotel" because they have a triple room over there. Case seems to be settled, but actually is not........... When we check in on 31Jul, Staff in the reservation desk inform us our room number is 210 without clear explanation where is it. We go to 2nd floor, there is no room 210. We go back to the reservation desk and ask where is it. The staff said "you have to know where is it, you go to 1st floor and there is signage. it is unbelievable that with a 4stars hotel, toilet totally like a mess, tap is broken, super dirty & somewhere is broken.......One set of toothbrush in toilet for 3 person, no cup for drink water We go back to the reservation desk and ask our request for an additional toothbrush and cup, his reply is " today is Sunday, I am the only one here, I am not your maid, I am working here in the reservation desk only. You can go if you don't like it." I really wonder I have settled all the payment of the hotel but he ask us to go?.........I really want to know who is the customer and did I stay in a 1 star hotel, no service, facilities is broken but with 4stars charges?. My opinions is , I am defintely not recommend this hotel and I have raised up a serious complaint to the booking cente.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING EXPERIENCE AND VERY GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: LecheX
Reviews.Content: Room Service was incredible. They were attentive and quick with my orders. The location is great for families due to the nice cafes and restaurants that are so nearby. My family and I also enjoyed sightseeing and walking to the Colosseum right from this hotel. We stayed for a week and saw most of Rome from just walking and wandering from the hotel. This hotel met both my families and my own needs and we were deeply satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, great location, huge room, water leak”
Reviews.Author: MotherMariettaGA
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Small, cute in great location. We checked into the hotel and Marco helped us put our bags in storage until check-in. When we returned, we checked in with David. He was extremely nice and spoke 5 languages and had lived in Rome for 30 years. Impressive. When we checked into our room, we were pleasantly surprised that is was huge and had an open balcony to the street and the basilica across the street. The only thing that was amiss was that there was a terrible mold smell and there was a leak from the bathroom shower out onto the carpet. The shower was rigged and sprayed out onto the floor. Even with towels, it was hard to contain water leakage. There were no more rooms and our only choice was to relocate to another one of their hotels a block away. We had returned late and didn't want to go through the hassle. David provided towels. We checked out for the airport before breakfast but the breakfast area looked cute. The hotel was connected to a chapel and some condos. It was a beautiful place but very costly for a smelly, hot night. Would recommend if they get the leak and the shower fixed. David and Marco were extremely pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Catanga
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotel experiences of my life. We litterally got there late at night just because we couldn't find anywhere else to stay. Got charged an absolute fortune because were given a room with 4 beds which was the only one left. It was disgustingly dirty, we couldn't operate the air con as they decide it's temperature. The furniture is cheap and it had cigarette burns sign on. I didn't have a shower cause it was too dirty and so were the bed linen. There were works going on that started at 7am, so we got very little sleep. When complained the morning after the receptionist told us that a lot of guests complain about the same things. Then the manager came and handled the whole thing pretty bad: I was talking to her in english as my partner doesn't understand italian and she kept answering in Italian. She blamed the cleaners for not doing their job, when obviously there were a number of issues that had nothing to do with them. And she kept a fake very annoied smile on her face all the way thorough. So STAY AWAY, for this standard you can find many two stars hotel in the area, so at least you'll be charged accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T FALL FOR SCAM”
Reviews.Author: solarpete
Reviews.Content: I got charged for a night I didn't stay because I booked online, because there was an error with the date. So I turned up thinking I had a reservation, and instead they had already charged me for the day before. Instead of accepting that there had been an error they refused to be reasonable and still charged my credit card. When I did stay the following night the room was very small, and nothing like a four star hotel. More like an expensive pensione.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: DBWilson
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at this hotel, my last night in Rome. I paid $156 for a single room. The room was tiny, the smallest I stayed in while in Italy, but it was clean. The shower head was bad, but the bathroom was clean and spacious. The breakfast was about average, but the breakfast staff was rude, which made it less pleasant. Building was nice, very historic, and there is a nice lounge on the 3rd floor for relaxing in. No free wifi, you have to pay by the 1/2 hour. The restaurant was also not open while I was there. I found the location convenient, as I was leaving by train early the next morning. The only really bad thing that happened, was that when I arrived the front desk woman told me that the hotel was closed due to plumbing problems and she told me she had made arrangements for me to stay at Hotel Valle, another hotel that they owned. I walked over there to find a lesser quality hotel and having prepaid 8 months prior, I walked back to Antico Palazzo to tell them that this was not acceptable and caught the front desk woman checking in another party. Then suddenly they had a room for me afterall. This left me with a bad feeling, and I won't be returning to this hotel the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for Rome!”
Reviews.Author: DavidG_8
Reviews.Content: Non- European readers/visitors to this hotel must realise the staff do not have English as their native language, so what is seen as staff rudeness/ignorance is just a question of understanding..a little patience, especially if tired from an overnight flight, will work wonders - I have had bad experiences in the US from 4 star Marriott trained staff!. We found them to be very helpful and friendly, our room was not ready when we arrived from the airport but they took charge of our luggage so we could start our Roman visits (2 days before starting our cruise). Our bags were in our room on return, but be aware the lift is narrow so egress can be fun when checking out. We had a family room (210) overlooking the square and found the hotel was just as advertised by our holiday advisor. It was clean, quiet and air-conditioned, just what was needed to rest after a busy day's activities in Rome. Large double bed for us and a good sized single for our daughter. The bathroom had been 'tarted up' and the shower now has a glass door with lots of hot water - all signs of age or mould has been sorted out so very acceptable for the price. The tour bus stopped just outside, perfect to 'do Rome' in a few hours, and Termini is 5/10 minute walk depending on how fit you are. We are fit but could'nt be bothered to walk early on a Sunday morning and got a taxi just outside. The church in the square is worth a look after a day touring Rome and before you sit down outside for your first beer. As previously mentioned, breakfast is a bit hit or miss, its Continental, so dont expect eggs 'over easy', just hot coffee and tea, croissants and scrambled eggs with some meat of unidentified origin!. Hey..when in Rome..! There is a small shop/store nearby where you can get water and drinks incl soda and wine/beer to take back to your room. On the first floor there is access to a lovely garden - the hotel does have an interesting history, which we were surprised to find mainly unused in the evening. We brought our store purchased drinks out there late in the cool evening to enjoy over a chat/cigar! The hotel does have a bar but as this is Rome there was nobody around to get you one so what the hell..our option was cheaper; the room has a mini bar we used to cool our drinks..and a safe. I can very highly recommend La Carbonnara and especially Antica Trattoria A Monti resturants (both on Via Panisperna 48 (google them) a pleasant 10 minute walk away from the tourist traps nearby..lovely food, very Italian, very popular, about 50 euro for 3 adult 3 course meals, soda, bottled water, bread, beer and a 1L carafe of house red..most acceptable, as is the walk back in the cool evening..window and people watching..across the narrow street from the Trattoria was a fascinating resturant/bar we would have loved to visit but didnt have the time..the whole place is covered in green foliage..great to sit and watch! Ask the hotel staff for a map and directions. Happy to answer any other questions by email. Enjoy. David

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel for the price in rome”
Reviews.Author: suziewongScotland
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews I was a bit concerned but found the hotel to be ok. Breakfast was fine just the usual for continental. Any queries we had the staff were most helpful. The room was average size and the bathroom was a good size though a bit dated. Clean towels every day . We had a safe and a mini bar. Our room faced into an alley and it was nice and quiet. I asked about a room facing onto the square but they did not have one. We were about 10 mins walk to the station and about 15 mins walk to the centre. Would recommend this hotel at the right price , we paid £100 per night approx for the room .

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL SUITED OUR NEEDS PERFECTLY”
Reviews.Author: hasol
Reviews.Content: location?- excellent-close to train station-on tour bus routes-walking distance to many tourist attractions. staff?- reception staff friendly and helpful;breakfast staff rude and uncooperative. room?-(408) acceptable-great air conditioning-clean bathroom-hot shower food?- typical continental breakfast worth the money?- if you get a deal,yes. overall- 7/10

Reviews.Title: “AVOID this hotel at all costs”
Reviews.Author: MissJA616
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be shut down for health reasons. Black mold in all 6 of the rooms they offered us. Hallways had evidence of mold in ceilings. The showers were filthy and disgusting. We left after two hours when our travel agent moved us to the Empire Palace (a TRUE 4-star hotel). Thank god we got out. I'm allergic to mold and just in the short time we were waiting for alternate accommodations, my lungs filled up and I fought a cold for the rest of our trip. I had asked my travel agent for a 4-star hotel and got this totally disgusting hotel. They are also refusing to refund our first night. NOT GOOD!!!! No bellman either - we had to lug our luggage up tiny elevators. They showed us a total of 6 rooms and each got progressively worse.....

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel of our trip”
Reviews.Author: Venetia020
Reviews.Content: The shower was damaged, appeared dirty and gave out a squirt rather than a shower. Although we reported that neither the mini-bar nor the safe functioned and the desk clerk said they would repair them this was not done and when we mentioned it they declared that it had been. Our original ("luxury") room was on the front (facing a major street) and when we requested a quiet room we were informed it was smaller however we were not informed that we would still have to pay the price of the "luxury" room despite staying in a tiny, uncomfortable room with no frig, no safe and miserable shower facilities. At least the room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel helped make our first trip to Rome very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Sealman51
Reviews.Content: In reading other reviews, I wonder what people are thinking. Our room was ample, even though the bathroom was on the small side, it was clean, the elevator was always available without any waiting, the breakfast was good and varied (even though we had to send the eggs back to the kitchen for some microwaving as they were cool), the seating area for breakfast was ample, and the staff was very helpful, especially Stefano. Taxi stand and tour bus stop were 50 meters from the front door. And even though our room window opened to an alley, so what? They had a lovely veranda to sit and relax on the fourth floor in the courtyard, and the courtyard itself was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: soycd115
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a few minutes walk from the Termini train station and quite easy to find being just over the road from the Santa Maria Maggiore’s basilica. I was given room 203 as a double room for single occupancy but think that the room would be on the smallish side for two people sharing. The room did not have a very auspicious view, looking out onto a side street (moped alley as I christened it) and could be quite noisy with the traffic. Plumbing from adjacent bathrooms was also noisy. There was a shower cubicle in the bathroom but no bath which was a bit of a miss. My friends who had paid the same amount had larger rooms with a bath and view of the internal courtyard. I did ask if I could change rooms but unfortunately I was told there were no free rooms to change with. Although the hotel website says it has a bar and restaurant we arrived there to be told there was no bar eventhough signs in the rooms do say there is a courtyard bar open until 11pm. I suggest the hotel amends this as it is mis-advertising. I would expect a 4 star hotel to have a bar and possibly coffee making facilities. Rooms were clean and serviced everyday with plenty of clean towels and toiletries. Breakfast was adequate but not exciting with tinned fruit cocktail every day, pretty poor cereal, croissants, scrambled eggs and hot dog sausages. The fresh coffee was nice however. My friend told reception that her hairdryer was not working on the second day and was told it would be looked at but by the time we checked out it had still not been fixed which inconvenienced her somewhat. The position of the hotel makes it fairly easy to access the major attractions on foot and there is also a bus stop just outside the hotel where you can get a tour bus. The hotel is clean and has lovely grand public rooms especially the reading room. It would however benefit from a bar, tea and coffee making facilities and better quality breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RenatoF
Reviews.Content: The owners have stopped maintaining the hotel and shut the restaurant and bar. It no longer qualifies as 4 star. Room 105 has an erratic and unsafe electical fusebox, stained ceiling, a shower stall that does not close, and the WC flush from above is so loud it is as if it is in the room. The room is tiny. Room 210 is also badly maintained. The drains back-up into the bidet, the bath mixer tap is loose on the wall and the bath is chipped. The breakfast area is small and the number of staff inadequate consequently the service available is not 4 star. The charge for WiFi usage is an absurd €25/day. The hotel opened as a 4 star plus in 2005 but the owners have shut the reception area and transferred reception to the original small group check-in area on the ground floor. The retaurant and bar were shut during our stay in May 2010. During the day there was one person on the front desk and a porter/waiter. The quality of the staff is good. The description of the hotel generally available does not reflect the obvious cost cutting.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel if you get a good rate and they honor your room selection”
Reviews.Author: robinm67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a nice spot- close to the train station and metro. The area always felt safe even at night. The rooms were a little worn with peeling wallpaper etc. The bathrooms were decent sized but the shower in both rooms we had leaked and there was mold on the walls in one bathroom. The breakfast was pretty good but get there early or many things will be gone. One issue I had was you can't take the stairs all the way up or down to your room. You had to take an elevator which was small and very slow. The staff was pretty nice but when we returned to Rome to stay the second time they downgraded our room from a quad to a triple due to the fact that "we only had three people" even though I paid for a quad room to ensure some extra space. They refused to refund a portion of the $300 a night rate to accommodate the downgrade and wouldn't move us to another room. This left a bad taste in my mouth and I most likely won't return to this hotel for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel where nobility would stay”
Reviews.Author: RSuri
Reviews.Content: Great location! Tour bus available right outside the hotel. The train station was 10 minutes away. The rooms were nice and clean with high ceilings. The room size was excellent -- nice and big. The bathrooms were a little dated. However, the property was well maintained. Nice patio area and a nice lounge available. The staff were friendly. Breakfast was okay. They offered eggs, sausage, yogurt, cereal and coffee each day. Made lattes on order. Outside our window we could see the Church St. Maria Margorie. Nice view. Good Italian eating place next door. The elevator from the lobby would go up a floor from where you had to transfer to another elevator (or you could walk up the 4 steps). Great job with the ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Just somewhere decent to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Karen&Mike
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 3 night break. Read reviews and was confident, however at first extremely dissappointed. First room was awful dark, no carpets, chipped bath shabby furniture (room 308) having told them we were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary I expected better. Second room not much better, third time lucky. We ended up with 301 which was opposite Santa Maria Maggiore church with lovely view. Nice size, but bathroom still a little shabby nowhere to put toiletries, slightly chipped bath and shower on cradle on bath taps. We settled here as best of rest. Breakfast was awful. Cold eggs and frankfurters, one style of bread roll, croissant (if you are lucky) and packet toast. Cheese in plastic and silver foil. However, if you don't mind a salami roll, standard tub of yogurt and coffee its adequate. Juice was squash. There is NO bar or restaurant even though in the room there is a sign which invites you to go the bar. At the back of the courtyard there is a restaurant that must have been sold off and is now nothing to do with the hotel. The public areas of the hotel (staircases and library are nicely furnished and well maintained but souless. There was never anyone around. Rome is beautiful, stunning, and this hotel is very central, if you want the bus it is right outside the hotel but everything Is within walking distance and it is in a pleasant location. We went out early morning and spent the day and evening out returning late for a relaxing bath and bed. For this reason the hotel was suitable. We did not want to waste money on a hotel that we were not spending much time in. If you get this hotel at a good price and dont want to spend time other than in your room, it is a good choice. Not really 4*. There is a nice looking restaurant on the corner (didnt have time to go there) and a really good restaurant with fantastic atmosphere on the Via Cavour ,sorry forgot name but specialised in chicken as well as usual Italian delights (fairy lights outside) the spit cooked chicken was excellent and the Italian Owner gave us a selection of Italian starters. Middle priced 65 eur for 3 courses and wine. Staff excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmigosBelfast
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem of a find value wise. It is within walking distance to most major tourist attractions. The hotel is basic but clean however the historical aspect to this hotel more than compensates. The staff were helpful and courteous. There any plenty of good value cafes and bars nearby. We used the two day tour bus which is great for seeing Rome at your own pace and leisure. You can walk as much as you want or simply hop on the tour bus. Overall an excellent hotel, one I would definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: alicealmondgreen
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The location was great (5 minutes from the Termini station), the room was clean, spacious, soundproofed and air conditioned. We also had a proper bathroom as opposed to just a showeroom. The staff were also helpful and friendly. We would certainly recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AKskiier
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel in a good location. Close to the railway station, metro and bus. There are many good restaurants nearby. Breakfast was very good and you could get both coffee or made to order espresso. They are short on front office staff, but the person there was always able to answer our questions and help us with where to go. I would recommend this hotel to anyone in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: RLD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights (August 2 to 5, 2007). We found it was clean and easy to walk everywhere and see the sights. The hotel was easy to get to from Tuscany. Straight in off the A1. We dropped our car off at the Avis dealer a block away and decided to take the express train back to the airport and this worked out very well. The driving in Italy was crazy and we were glad to return the car!!!! The train station is a short 7 minute walk. We purchased our tickets the day before and simply walked onto the express train in the morning of our flight. This was the way to do it! No fuss or car return problems. Avis was great as there is no fee for returning the car to another location. I found this a grand hotel. It is nicely decorated and we appreciated the free internet access. Breakfast was quite suitable. We were looking for a triple room (traveling with our 21 year old daughter) and this was a very good deal. Our room was on the courtyard and was very quiet. We had a "stay for 3 and pay for 2" deal, so it equalled out to about 130 Euros a night. This was a good deal for Rome in August. We ate at some lovely places within walking distance. The hotel staff was helpful and especially the staff on the main door. My only disappointment was certainly not the hotel, but rather not being allowed to enter the Sistine Chapel as my arms were bare (no shawl). I am still upset about this. Other than that, we saw a lot of Rome in 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Because It's Not worth It!”
Reviews.Author: AHF_7
Reviews.Content: 4 Star its certainly not. Room is okay. Modernish and clean. Bathroom only small with shower cubicle no bath. Mould a problem I would say and shower plug blocked. Could have put up with that if the staff had been nicer, but they werent, more of service with a snarl except for one chap on night duty. For GBP132 per night I expected more (sorry I know its Rome but still) and something more central than it really is. Unless you want to be within 10 mins walk of the main station that is. With the lack of any inviting public areas and a junior porter who blocked me from getting out of the lift whilst he had an argument with another member of staff (2 days in a row) then just completely ignored my attempts to get out, was just a bit too much for me to want to stay here again. Described as a Luxury Hotel former residence of some Pope on the Easyjet Hotel portal ? 3 Star okay for 1 or 2 nights and overpriced is more appropiate in my opinion. Sorry dont like slagging hotels but I was really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: AnneBarnstaple
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a four night stay, and were impressed. We had a lovely room at the front of the hotel, so good views. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We thought the hotel was in a good location, and walked with ease to most places of interest. Breakfast adequate for continental. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK - but not 4 star and not all services as listed”
Reviews.Author: cazanchris
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights at this hotel in Feb and came away feeling that it was ok, but would not stay there again. The location is great and it looks good from the outside with all public areas looking very good. Our room was clean and tidy with a king size bed and serviced daily with clean towels. The bathroom let it down - VERY small, a window with a sign saying 'please do not open window', no ventilation and a fixed head shower that is OK if you are over 6ft tall - but at least there was plenty of hot water. One reason we chose this hotel is it lists on it's own web site and on tripadvisor as having a cocktail bar - we like to relax with a coffee and drink at the end of the evening, but we were told at reception that there is no bar and you must use the minibar in your room (which has limited drinks) - no tea/coffee facilities in room. Overall I would say good 3 star, but struggles to be a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Like having your own roman palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Continenthopper
Reviews.Content: Anyone who has read my other reviews will know that I like hotels that feel like a better version of home. This one fits the bill. The whole place is spotless and gleaming. Some rooms are better than others, with views of Santa Maria Maggiore. Mine looked onto a side street, which was still quaint and got plenty of light. I booked a double room for single use, so it was pretty roomy and had a very big bed for just a little more money. My mother had just booked a standard single room, which was a little on the small side. The best part was the 2nd floor library with marble floors, comfy chairs and sofas, and some decent books and magazines in stock. We had some other friends staying in Rome at the same time, so this was good place for us all to meet up without having to crowd into someone's room or loiter in the lobby. It was also a good place to just go and relax between sightseeing and dinner. It definitely felt like I had my own Roman palazzo at a really reasonable price. Breakfast was fine. We were there in winter, so didn't get to experience it in the courtyard, which must be a great thing! The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the location was very convenient to transport and all that Rome has to offer. We walked everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “great 8 night stay!”
Reviews.Author: tkere
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel for 8 nights, Dec. 23 to Dec. 31, 2006. When we checked in the afternoon, the rooms were ready. There is a small elevator for use in the hotel. We had 2 rooms overlooking the center courtyard (double and triple). This was lovely and very quite. We had friends that had 2 rooms looking out at the Basillica on the street and it was a little more noisy (but they sleep with the windows open). Room: Nice size. The beds very comfortable. We had a full length mirror but my kids did not (not a problem for us). We had a bathtub with a hand spray which I thought may be a problem, but we loved it. The spray was hot and strong. My kids had a shower. The bathrooms were a nice size and there were some shampoo ammeneties and a small bar of soap there (I also brought a bar for the shower). I bring my own shampoo everywhere too. There is a toilet and bidet (could not get the hang of this...I am too American I guess!). There is TV with CNN international and bbc world in english and my kids loved MTV which has Italian commentary but they do not dub over the stars comments and songs. There is a refrigerator with waters, soda (cans), juice and wine. We bought waters and sodas (plastic bottles) and stored some in the frig and it was not a problem so we were not charged for waters, etc. There is a hanging closet and a small draw. The storage was enough for me and half of hubbies (he kept extra stuff in the suitcase on the luggage tray). My kids kept stuff in their suitcases because there was not alot of storage room in the room and they tend to do this anyway at many hotels. They are teens, so I let them manage their own clothes. The rooms are not adjoining, but that was not a problem for us. The windows have shutters that close and keep it dark if you want to sleep a little late one day. Overall, very comfortalbe. Breakfast: nice continental breakfast. The friendly staff make you a cappuccino or expresso. There is regular coffee, hot tea, hot milk and cold milk, cereals, muffins, crackers, pastries, hot weiners, cheese and salami and ham, hard boiled eggs, fruit (pineapple or peaches) and yogurts each day. The rooms is cheery the table has linens and plates have charger plates underneath, so it is very lovely. Staff: Very friendly and helpful. Gave us directions when we wanted and always responded to my emails prior to my stay. Hotel: there is several sitting areas (including one off the lobby for meeting friends) and a library (very nice) and computer with internet connection for free. The hotel seems to attract a European crowd since it does not advertise in most USA internet sites I have used. It was family friendly and 3 blocks from the Termini. There is also a taxi stand across the street and many buses go by. The open bus stops there too. There is SMA (supermarket) across the piazza and a UPIM (department store) too. Make sure you stop by the coffee shop next door for an afternoon latte. Phillip was very friendly and said hello to us each day. My girls thought he was attractive too! Overall: We loved the stay! We slept great, had a wonderful time in 'Rome and the hotel was quite a bargain. We paid 100 euros per night for the triple and 90 for the double (except on Dec. 30 when the price went up for the holiday weekend).

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: vancanuck
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here in early Oct 2006 with a very good experience overall. Clean, large room with friendly service and small hotel feel. Initial night was fully booked and we had a smaller room, but hotel happily moved us next day to a large room overlooking the church. Rooms very quiet. Breakfast quite good and reasonable selection. Large library and Internet access in common area for free. Location very central and easy access for transit. Had a very good stay, and good value for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: oonagh2767
Reviews.Content: We got married in Rome at the beginning of June and this was the hotel we stayed in before and after the wedding. I tried emailing them 4 times as I was trying to find out the best way to get there and got no reply which should have given me an idea of what the hotel was going to be like! We got a taxi from Termini (a 5 minute walk) and got charged 20 Euro!! But that is to be expected from taxi drivers taking advantage of tourists. When we arrived at the hotel the room was a disappointment. It was dark and the furniture was shabby, the bathroom was grubby with no stand up shower, which is unbelievable in this day and age. In addition it had 2 single beds pushed together, great for our wedding night!! The hotel did not even provide soap for the bathroom never mind shampoo and the other toiletries you expect in a 4 star hotel. When I asked if there was a room with better light as I couldn’t imagine getting ready for my wedding in a room with no natural light, the staff were thoroughly unhelpful. I asked if they had a full length mirror and was told that they did not. The breakfast was fine and the location was the best thing about this hotel. You are within walking distance from the Coliseum and the Spanish steps with termini train station (the main station in Rome) just 5 minutes away. On our first night there we opened the windows and heard fantastic singing from Santa Maria Maggiore which is just across from the hotel, which was very special. I would not stay in this hotel again, although the location was excellent this did not make up for the unhelpful staff and dark dingy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, big rooms and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 13ab
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Le Cappellette di San Luigi for 5 days in 2005 and really enjoyed it. We booked the hotel through Travelante, which was a first, but we received a fantastic offer on the hotel (saved up to 60 percent). The room (we had) was big, with a view of the courtyard (can recommend it, but don't know if it will be noisy in the summertime as we were there in march). It was very clean, decoration was good, there was plenty of room to move about. The adjoining bathroom was standard but nice and clean. The hotel is situated in an excellent location, for the St. Maria Maggiore is just across the street. The hotel is about ten minutes walking from Termini station. In front of the St. Maria Maggiore, there is a hop-on-hop-off busstop. The breakfast was good, not extraordinary but plenty of everything and buffetstyle. Ask for a nice fresh cup of coffee and someone will bring that to your table! The hotel itself has a small feel to it, it is a nice old building. Personnel was nice and tried to make an extra effort.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for a Pope a Palace for a Pauper!”
Reviews.Author: suziehamster
Reviews.Content: my word what a lovely hotel, we are just back from a 3 day stay at the Cappellette di San Luigi and were awstruck by the beauty and antiquity of this 4 star hotel. the hotel is located in a 500 year old Italian palazzo which is much nicer inside than out. The building is steeped in history and you should take time to read the information contained within the hotel web site. For example the Cappellette di San Luigi was the former residence of Cardinal Giulio Rospigliosi who became Pope Clement the 4th in 1667! All public areas including reception, reading room, breakfast room exude style in every direction and the icing on the cake must surely be the 19th century church which is contained within the Hotel (ask the concierge to take you to see it!!!!) The location is ideal overlooking the Square of Santa Maria Maggiore which is half way between Termini railway station and the Colosseum. We booked direct with the hotel through their own web site and paid approximately 120 euro for a double room in low season, very good value considering their official published price is 300! We are already planning to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in central Rome, service is good, cleanliness and rooms are above average when you consider the price and the category.

HotelInfo.Name: Antico Palazzo Rospigliosi
HotelInfo.Address: Via Liberiana 21, 00185 Rome, Italy
